newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Details of Russian Eurobond issues.
newsitem.headline: Details of Russian Eurobond issues.

text.p: Russia plans to apply for permission to make a global bond issue this autumn, likely to be dollar-denominated. It will issue three Eurobonds in 1998, probably one in yen.
Russian entities have issued the following Eurobonds and announced the following plans for issues:
ISSUED:

ST PETERSBURG - June 1997; $300 million; May 2002; priced to yield 312.5 bp over five-year U.S. Treasuries (May 2002); leads Salomon Brothers; coupon 9.50 pct; S&P BB-, IBCA BB+ for long-term investment, B for short-term investment; road-show on May 23; IBCA rated the issue at BB+ for long-term investment, S&P assigned BB- for long-term foreign currency debt

CITY OF MOSCOW - May 1997, $500 million May 2000; priced to yield 315 bp over 6.375 pct three-year U.S Treasuries (May 2000); leads CS First Boston, Nomura International; coupon 9.50 pct; Moody's Ba2, Standard & Poor's BB-

RUSSIAN FEDERATION - March 1997, 2.0 billion marks, seven years (maturing March 25, 2004); leads Deutsche Morgan Grenfell, CS First Boston; coupon 9.0 pct, priced to yield 370 basis points over seven-year (March 2004) German government bonds; S&P BB-

RUSSIAN FEDERATION - November 1996, $1 billion, five years (maturing November 27, 2001); leads JP Morgan, SBC Warburg; coupon 9.25 pct, priced to yield 345 points over five-year U.S. Treasuries (5.875 pct notes due November 30, 2001); Moody's Ba2, S&P BB-, IBCA BB+
PLANNED:
SOVEREIGN
RUSSIAN FEDERATION - dollar Eurobond planned in the second half of June; at least seven years; leads JP Morgan, SBC Warburg; road-show June 11-18
RUSSIAN FEDERATION - plans to apply for permission to make a global bond issue this autumn, likely to be dollar-denominated.
RUSSIAN FEDERATION - rouble Eurobond in 1998
RUSSIAN FEDERATION - $3 bln through three Eurobond issues in 1998. One issue likely to be yen-denominated.
REGIONS AND MUNICIPALITIES
MOSCOW (CITY) - plans a Eurobond in 1997
CHELYABINSK - $100 million
IRKUTSK REGION - early 1998, $80 million; advisers All-Russian Bank for Regional Development (agent), ING-Barings (ratings consultant)
ING-Barings to recommend S&P and Moody's rating agencies.
ING-Barings said it had an advantage in being chosen as lead-manager
KOMI REPUBLIC - $200 million, five years
MARY EL REPUBLIC - likely to drop Eurobond plans
MOSCOW (REGION) - up to $400 million, three to five years; lead SBC Warburg; expects ratings from Moody's and IBCA in June
NIZHNY NOVGOROD - up to $100 million late June 1997; five-years; Moody's Ba2, S&P BB-; plans to submit issue prospectus to the Finance Ministry end of May, or early in June; ING-Barings

PERM REGION - between $50 and $200 million; ING-Barings, Inkombank (rating advisers); ING-Barings, Inkombank, Bank Menatep bid for lead-managing position, expects an application from Creditanstalt-Grant.
SAMARA REGION - July 1997; $250-$400 million in several issues with a monthly interval
SVERDLOVSK - August 1997; $100 million, six-seven years (plans total $300 million over several years); leads WestMerchant Bank, Inkombank (adviser/co-manager)
TATARSTAN REPUBLIC - end 1997, $200 million
SAKHA REPUBLIC (YAKUTIA) - several Eurobond issues; lead manager to be chosen by end of June
CORPORATE
ALMAZY ROSSII-SAKHA (ARS) - $100 million by end of 1997; later $300 million annually
GAZPROM - at least $1 billion; late 1997; ABN-Amro, Goldman Sachs
LUKOIL - 1998 at earliest
MGTS - second half of 1997; $150 million, three to five years, 9.5 pct; leads CS First Boston, Salomon Bros; expects rating in September
MOSENERGO - late 2nd qtr/early 3rd qtr 1997, $150 million, about five years; lead Salomon Bros; expects S&P rating in May
RED OCTOBER - about $20 million; K.O. Finansy (adviser)
ROSTELEKOM - 1997; S&P BB-
TATNEFT - second half 1997 or later; lead Dresdner Kleinwort Benson (recommended)
BANKS
INKOMBANK - mid-1997, two-three years
NATSIONALNY REZERVNY BANK - rating in 1997
PROMSTROIBANK ST PETERSBURG - 1997, $50-$100 million, working with CS First Boston
UNEXIMBANK - mid-1997, $100-200 million, three-five years; IBCA - long-term BB, short-term B, individual C/D, legal 2T
SBS-AGRO (STOLICHNY BANK SBEREGENY) - road-shows June 24-July 2; leads JP Morgan Securities.
--Moscow Newsroom, +7095 941 8520
